content.rendered:
Call Of Papers

Background

The Knowledge Graph and Semantic Web Conference is an international scientific conference series devoted to knowledge graph and semantic web research. Due to COVID-19 pandemic, this edition of the conference will be online. The prime goals of the conference are:


(i) to provide a forum for the semantic web community, bringing together researchers and practitioners in industry to share ideas about R&D projects and

(ii) to increase the adoption of semantic web technologies in the region.


Topics

Topics of interest include, but not limited to:

Combining Semantic Graphs with Property Graphs

Deep Learning on Knowledge Graphs

Probabilistic Knowledge Graphs

Text Mining and Natural Language Processing

Linked Data

Social Web & Web Science

Mobile Web, Sensors and Semantic Streams

Services, APIs, Processes and Cloud Computing

Vocabularies, Schemas, Ontologies

Reasoning

Benchmarking and Empirical Evaluation

Scientific Semantic Web

Submissions and Proceedings


KGSWC 2023 invites to submit high-quality unpublished research papers on the topics of the conference. The submissions cannot be under review or acceptance for publication in a journal or another conference. The papers will be reviewed by at least three independent reviewers and submitted for plagiarism detection check.


The submissions must be written in English using the guidelines resources (Springer Guide). We receive full papers (12-15 pages) and short papers (6-8 pages) and may be submitted in PDF via the Easychair system below:


https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=kgswc2022


It is planned to publish the proceedings of KGSWC 2022 with Springer in their Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series. As we did on 2019, 2020 and 2021.
